resources.string: If I work 8hrs/day and make $10 and hour, then I can afford an apartment for $1500.
If I make $1500/month, then I can invest $500 in Bitcoin.
If I make $2000/month I should save $50 in my bank.
Food and shelter determine my monthly cost of living.
If I do not have enough to purchase holiday gifts, then it\'s OK to use a credit card.
False: \nMost apartments require 3-4x salary to live. In this case you will need a place that costs $400 - $500.

False: \nIt\'s a rule of thumb to only invest with a small amount you won\'t lose sleep over. You must also take into account your overall living expenses. In this case $10 may be a good amount to invest in bitcoin once a month.
True: \nYou should save 5% or more of your monthly income. A savings account may not five a high return but it is seen as a safe way to store funds.
\False: \n Your cost of living should incorporate all aspects of your monthly costs. Food, utility, shelter and more.
False: \nYou should never buy something you do not have the funds for. Also, never use a credit cardâ€¦never.
